intro: Plagiobothrys asper, commonly known as the rough bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, white or pale purple flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along roadsides. Plagiobothrys asper is an annual or biennial herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local pollinators.
